result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dearmon T Major

records.addlTxt:
Court is in trial and unable to hear this case.  Case rescheduled off the record.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Dearmon T Major not in court, in custody.  Josh Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Motion Hearing.  Defense counsel withdraws request for motion hearing.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING ( 12 pages) commencing 05-12-2022 by SANDRA M. KANDZIORA.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Dearmon T Major not in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense counsel requests a motion hearing date. Defense to file motion by 7/8/2022. State to respond by 8/5/2022. Case adjourned to Branch 35 IN PERSON. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR.35
Defendant Dearmon T Major in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appear by video.  Defendant Dearmon T Major in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of 20CF2640.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Clifford.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 35.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with VIL (DOB 7.8.2001) and her family; SC (DOB 7.22.2000); M.B. (DOB 12.2.2019); L.B. (DOB 2.8.2021)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Dearmon T Major in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Dearmon T Major in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dearmon T Major appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 35.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
